meanings.definition: A part or division of a larger whole
meanings.sent1: The toy car's wheels are a subpart of the entire vehicle.
meanings.sent2: Each chapter in the book is a subpart of the whole story.
meanings.sent3: The subpart of the puzzle was missing, making it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, each tree is like a subpart of the vast green canopy above.
meanings.sent5: The subpart of the necklace that broke off was easily replaced.

meanings.definition: To divide into smaller parts or sections
meanings.sent1: She will subpart the cake into equal slices for everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will subpart the class into groups for the group project.
meanings.sent3: He tried to subpart the problem into smaller, more manageable pieces.
meanings.sent4: The chef will subpart the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent5: It is important to subpart the work evenly among team members for efficiency.
